meanings.definition: The act of procuring or obtaining something
meanings.sent1: Her procuration of the rare book was a great success.
meanings.sent2: The company's procuration of new clients boosted its sales.
meanings.sent3: His procuration of the last piece of cake made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The detective's procuration of evidence was like piecing together a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The procuration of fresh flowers for the event added a touch of elegance.

meanings.definition: The authority to act on behalf of someone else
meanings.sent1: With the procuration granted, she could sign the documents.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer's procuration allowed him to make legal decisions for his client.
meanings.sent3: The cat's procuration of treats from the owner was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's procuration of authority in the classroom was firm but fair.
meanings.sent5: The procuration of power of attorney gave him the ability to make decisions on her behalf.

meanings.definition: The process of managing or overseeing something
meanings.sent1: The procuration of the project was handled efficiently by the team.
meanings.sent2: His procuration of the budget ensured the project stayed on track.
meanings.sent3: The procuration of the party planning turned into a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her procuration of the event was like conducting a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The procuration of the construction site required careful supervision.
